bio:treatment.other_name: Yellow or wild or cutleaf mignonette
bio:treatment.discussion: In Australia, Reseda lutea is considered an invasive introduction that causes damage to crops; research is being carried on for means to control its expansion. It has been used as a dye plant, to a lesser extent than R. luteola. It has been found to have antibacterial activity against some pathogens. There is also potential utility for phytoremediation in soils contaminated with copper.

references.reference: Harris, J. D., E. S. Davis, and D. M. Wichman. 1995. Yellow mignonette (Reseda lutea) in the United States. Weed Technol. 19: 196â€“198.
